data.title: Surgery recovery food
data.text:
I am writing this for my wife who just had knee replacement surgery. I asked her what she wanted to eat and the only thing she said was Boneyard Ribs. So, without a second question that's where we went for carry in. The portions are large, HUGE. 
The ribs are meaty and very juiced and the bar-be-que sauce that comes on the side is wonderful. 
They also serve a very large portion of potatoes on the side. My wife was in her glory after 4 days of hospital food.

data.title: great ribs
data.text: best ribs in town, eat in or carry out . good value and good service, full bar. could use some updating

data.title: Great Food!!!
data.text: Love eating at this restaurant. They have the best barbecue chicken ever!!! The staff is ok, but the food is exceptional. Never disappointed when I choose to eat there.

data.title: Dinner for four for less than €40.
data.text: I didn't realise till the bill arrived that it was possible to eat this well, this cheaply. Two salads, a pulled pork sandwich and fish and fries. A round of drinks and two coffees. Great food, service and surroundings - I'll be back.

data.title: Motown "Q"
data.text: Portions so large you could have shared. I actually had an appetizer of the Rib tips. Over a pound of them. Couldn't finish them. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Food was excellent.

data.title: Good local BBQ
data.text: This is a good local BBQ joint, food was good, service was good and quick. The only shortcoming for me was no beef ribs.

data.title: BAD BAD BAD
data.text: Service in this resturant was lacking. Server ( Katie ) never came back to check how our meal was or refill drinks. Did not see her after dinner was served until she brought our check. Chicken had taste of being reheated leftovers. burnt on the outside. bread was toasted on one side only and it was also burnt. i think server did not want to come back to table because she knew she served bad food. Will NOT be going back to this resturant.

data.title: Great BBQ Sauce!
data.text:
This place is good for families or special occasions,
Sometimes the food is amazing and sometimes its not. 
Its a hit and miss Depends on when you go. 
Most of the time the food is really good. 
The BBQ sauce is what makes my boyfriend and I coming back.

data.title: Horrible!!!
data.text: I've been going here for years . The management here has gone to pot!!! After 1 1/2 hours I went home without a meal !!! First my Greek salad had SOLID OIL dressing !! The waitress took it back and said I SHOULD HAVE made it myself ! The dressing wasn't mixed ! Next the home frys  we LOVE were dark brown and charred it was like they were made from ROTTEN potatoes !! My ribs were BLACK AND HARD AS A ROCK !!! when she asked if everything was ok I wasn't even going to bother saying . I said NO look at these ribs . She said oh I did see that before I brought them out ? Hmm why bring them then ??? Wonderful management told her serve them anyway !! They are just money hungry and care nothing about customers or their mistreated underpaid staff!!! Time to move on Boneyard your good days are over . We will never return as others won't with food and service like this !! SAD !!

data.title: Worse quality food
data.text: This was by far one of the worse dining experiences I've ever had. The ribs were dry and tasteless, my hubby got sick from his New York strip. When the manager was advised she seemed unconcerned that her meat might be contaminated. I will never go back to this restaurant.

data.title: Ribs, ribs and more ribs!!
data.text: The Boneyard is a family restaurant that serves outstanding ribs.  I have been eating at The Boneyard for several years and have been rarely disappointed.  Their IS an occasional 'tough' rack; however, given the number of years that I have eaten at this restaurant (well over 25 years), I can only remember one or two occasions when I haven't been completely satisfied.  Of course, if you are looking for Damon-type ribs (YUCK) or Famous Dave's (which is the Mickey D's of Rib dinners - in my estimation) then you will be disappointed because the ribs at The Boneyard taste as though they have been cooked on site (and they are)!  This is not a place to go for 'ambience' or 'romance' or anything but a finger-licking experience!  The only 'complaint' that I have is that we were there during an especially busy weekend day - when there were several large parties and an 'event' occurring in their large 'party' area.  There were several 'un-bussed' tables awaiting clean up which was being delayed because ALL of the waitstaff was busily helping their occupied tables.  This caused an undue wait for a table.  Unfortunately, my complaint stems from the fact that the owner of this location employs a relative as a hostess: a tall, unattractive,  dark haired woman who ALWAYS acts as though she is 'above it all'.  And of course, she is certainly "too good" to possibly break a nail actually working.  So she's getting herself a soda, and is standing around looking bored when in MY opinion she should have been assisting her family's business by helping to clean tables to eliminate the back-up of waiting diners. When we were finally seated, the food was delicious, served promptly and at the right temperature.  I felt very sorry for our waitress and believe that the "hostess" should find another way to underwrite the desperately needed plastic surgery in order to 'become' who she thinks she is!!

data.title: good food!! worth the money!
data.text: This was our first time too eat there! it was worth the money we spent! very satisfied!! good food!!

data.title: Not really authentic
data.text:
Just finished eating our meal from this Boneyard location and I have to say that I am greatly disappointed. This place has certainly fallen from what it once was. 
The portion sizes remain large, to be fair...but WOW!  I don't know if the amount of food you get in a bad meal is even worth it. Once upon a time, the ribs and chicken were moist and flavorful. What I partook of this evening was the equivalent of putting a handful of sawdust in my mouth. The garlic bread (that I used to love) was flavorless. Could taste nothing but grease with the Cottage fries. The ribs and chicken were tough, dry and very disappointing. 
Won't be going back anytime soon...if ever

data.title: gift certificate not taken
data.text: we got a gift cert for xmas,couldnt use it at livonia location.had to pay cash for a terrible meal.ribs were tough  sauce was terrible  chicken was dry   .we had a carry out and they just threw all the food in boxes without any concern what it looked like when it came out.very disappointed,will never ever eat there again .suprised they are still in business.bad service when we tried to use certificate.rude .rude .rude manager

data.title: Bring your appetite
data.text: I agree with the concensous of the reviewers regarding this restaurant. I enjoyed both the good points (tasty ribs & big portions) and observed some weaknesses (dated decor) Overall yummy ribs & great value so I recommend that you give this place a try.

data.title: Contandina is not barbeque sauce
data.text: The last time I ate at Boneyard it was awful. It seemed as if they opened up a can of contandina tomato paste and caled it barbecue sauce

data.title: Ok, not fantastic
data.text: Food was good, but not exceptional. It has been many years since I ate at this restaurant. Decor is the same....sorta dated, & not impressive. BBQ sauce is not really anything out of the ordinary.

data.title: Great Ribs!
data.text: For take-out these are a great deal. You get a whole lot of ribs with a potato and salad for under 20 bucks.

data.title: Ribbit!
data.text: The only place in the Detroit area (other than at my house) to eat ribs. They are a little chewey, as ribs are supposed to be, and saucey.  They don't fall off of the bone as other places boast about.  If they fell off the bone, I sure as heck wouldn't advertise the fact.  Keep it up guys, great ribs, none better

data.title: Nice place to get together with friends!
data.text: Enjoyable night out with family or friends. Affordable with big portions! We have ate here several times with absolutely no complaints.
